instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight.
threads.message:
H, everyone.
I've received it to repair as liquid damaged.
Dead board and after some work and jump wires on <RESISTOR>R5620</RESISTOR> pins 3 and 4 to it's test points and cleaning, it now turns on.
Bad liquid on LCD connector and no display.
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> shorted. Fixed by replacing the <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> MUX converter. It now has display, but no backlight. External display works fine and boot to the system.
Tested with another working LCD and LCD flex cable.
No short on backlight circuit fuse F8400 ok.
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - 0V - 178K
<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_FET_DRV_R</SIGNAL> - 0V

<CHIP>U9801</CHIP> - <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V
Diode mode - <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.542

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S5_GPIOX_R</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_GPIOX_R</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<RESISTOR>R1528</RESISTOR> - <SIGNAL>EDP_IG_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.36V

I also replaced U980.
I run out of knowledges please, help.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight.
threads.message:
Inspect for corroded components in the backlight circuitry.
Pay atention to resistors and traces near <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>; you may need to resolder, or replace it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight.
threads.message:
Diode mode measurements on RB923 pin 1 were incorrect, but resistor is OK.
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> resoldered.

Backlight is on.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight.
threads.message:
For some reason, the backlight stopped again.
No idea what's going on here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight.
threads.message: Check all resistors value and resolder them.
